intro: Pedicularis koshiensis, commonly known as the Koshi lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Nepal and northern India. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes numerous parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a distinctive red or purple throat. It typically grows in high-altitude meadows and rocky areas, thriving in cool, moist environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
